Detailed Description

Joint Model.

It's possible to attach some nodes from different collections to this model.

const Char *  node_name
) 
 

Attaches specified node from list of Joint3DNode nodes to the common model.

Parameters:
j3dcoll - list of Joint3DNode nodes.
node_name - name of node to attach.
Returns:
Returns True, if node was found and attached, else - False.

void Create (  vector< ObjRef< Joint3DNode > > &  j3dcoll  ) 
 

Creates Joint3D model from specified Joint3DNode list.

All nodes from this list will be attached to the model. Every time you call Create, current model will be cleared. You don't need to call RefreshLinks() function after calling this function.

Parameters:
j3dcoll - list of Joint3DNode nodes.

Bool Detach (  const Char *  node_name  ) 
 

Detaches specified node from model.

Parameters:
node_name - name of node to detach.
Returns:
Returns True if successful, else - False.

Returns current animation set.

Int GetPlayDirection (   ) 
 

Returns the play directions state.

Returns:
Returns 1, if play direction is "forward", returns 0, if play direction is "stop", returns -1, if play direction is "backward".

void Play (  Int  time_step = 160  ) 
 

Continues play animation with specified time step.

Call this function per one AI run.

Parameters:
time_step define play time.

Bool RefreshLinks (   ) 
 

Refresh links of model.

You should call this function every time after calling Attach() or Detach() functions.

void Set (  ObjRef< Joint3DAnimation >  j3danim_,
Int  time_,
Int  loop_play_ = 0
) 
 

Sets specified Joint3DAnimation object to play and animation show time.

Parameters:
j3danim_ - pointer to Joint3DAnimation class object.
time_ - define start animation time.
loop_play_ - if zero animation will be stop in the end of playing on last frame else continue playing from first frame.

void SetResultTransform (  const Matrix4fx &  rm  )  [virtual]
 

Sets Joint3D result transform matrix.

void UpdateTransform (   )  [virtual]
 

Updates result transform matrices of Joint3D and all nodes.

Need to call after Joint3D matrix transform update.

Reimplemented from Basic3D.

Member Data Documentation

Int play_direction [protected]
 

Play direction.

This variable updates by calling Play() function. If parameter (time_step) of this function > 0, than play_direction is "forward" (value = 1). If parameter (time_step) of this function == 0, than play_direction is "stop" (value = 0). If parameter (time_step) of this function < 0, than play_direction is "backward" (value = -1).
